holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday emerged from various kindness campaigns aiming to promote compassion in daily life.

holidays.name: Name Your Car Day
holidays.description: A quirky day to give your beloved vehicle a unique, funny, or affectionate name.
holidays.origin: Started in the automotive enthusiast community as a humorous way to personify their cars, fostering a sense of camaraderie among drivers.
holidays.funFact: Some famous cars like KITT from Knight Rider and Herbie the Love Bug are essentially celebrities because of their memorable names!

holidays.name: Gandhi Jayanti (India)
holidays.description: A national holiday in India commemorating the birthday of Mahatma Gandhi, the leader of the peaceful Indian independence movement.
holidays.origin: Observes Gandhi's birthday to honor his philosophy of non-violence and truth.
holidays.funFact: On Gandhi Jayanti, people around the world celebrate the 'International Day of Non-Violence' inspired by his teachings.

holidays.name: World Farm Animals Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness about the plight of farm animals and promote animal rights and welfare.
holidays.origin: Established by animal advocacy groups to spotlight the ethical treatment of farm animals worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Despite being overshadowed by cuter pets, farm animals top the list in numbers globally and play a huge role in the food chain.
